text:
Raskolnikov leaned on the rail, staring into the distance. 

He felt weak after parting with Razumihin. 

The sunset painted the sky pink. 

Darkness crept over the houses. 

He watched a distant window flicker like fire. 

The water of the canal caught his eye. 

Suddenly, red circles flashed before him. 

The world danced; he felt faint. 

A tall woman appeared beside him. 

Her yellow face was sunken, her eyes vacant. 

She leaned over the railing. 

Then she jumped into the canal. 

“Help! A woman drowning!” voices shouted. 

People rushed to the banks, crowding around. 

Raskolnikov stood frozen, heart racing.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling weak and disoriented, witnesses a woman throw herself into the canal, prompting a crowd to react in alarm.
